verbs.description: scrattle (third-person singular simple present scrattles, present participle scrattling, simple past and past participle scrattled)

examples: But if I'm duly sensible of this,
And if I really fear to do amiss,
How, George, how (in the name of wonder!) then,
Dares my poor, puny, scurvy, scrattling pen
Presume thy neat performances to trace,
And, with mean words, thy beauteous works debase

entries.meaning: To make shift, to manage to get along.
examples: My husband says “What's the good of scrattling and saving, Edna, when in two–three years we might all be blown up by an atom bomb?
